tool.name: msp-to-metfrag
tool.description: Read MS2 spectra from MSP file and create MetFrag parameter file.

param.name: minintthr
param.label: Intensity threshold of largest peak
param.help: The threshold the largest peak must have to be recognized

param.name: minprop
param.label: Minimum proportion of peaks
param.help: All peaks less than a percentage value with regard to the largest peak are rejected

param.name: pretofrag
param.label: Neutral losses of precursor to fragments
param.help: Add neutral losses of precursor to fragments of the spectrum

param.name: fragtofrag
param.label: Neutral losses of fragments to fragments
param.help: Add neutral losses among fragments to fragments of the spectrum

param.name: polarity
param.label: Polarity
param.help: The polarity used for the mode of acquisition

param.name: DatabaseSearchRelativeMassDeviation
param.label: Database Search Relative Mass Deviation
param.help: A value in ppm that defines the deviation of theoretical masses in the database vs. the measured masses

param.name: FragmentPeakMatchAbsoluteMassDeviation
param.label: Fragment Peak Match Absolute Mass Deviation
param.help: Absolute mass deviation in Dalton of theoretical fragment peaks vs. measured fragment peaks

param.name: FragmentPeakMatchRelativeMassDeviation
param.label: Fragment Peak Match Relative Mass Deviation
param.help: Relative mass deviation in ppm of theoretical fragment peaks vs. measured fragment peaks

param.name: suspectfile
param.label: Suspect list
param.help: File containing a list of suspects

param.name: FilterExcludedElements
param.label: Filter Excluded Elements
param.help: List of elements that should be excluded. Elements are comma separated without whitespace.

param.name: FilterIncludedElements
param.label: Filter Included Elements
param.help: List of elements that should be included. Elements are comma separated without whitespace.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**Authors**
| **Kristian Peters (kpeters@ipb-halle.de)** wrote and maintains this module.
---------------------------------------------------
======================== MSP to MetFrag parameter ========================
----------- Description -----------
| Read spectra from MSP file and create MetFrag parameter file.
----------- Input files -----------
+------------------------------+------------+ | File | Format | +==============================+============+ | 1) MSP file(s) | MSP | +------------------------------+------------+
---------- Parameters ----------
Intensity threshold of largest peak | The threshold the largest peak must have to be recognized. |
Minimum proportion of peaks | All peaks less than a percentage value with regard to the largest peak are rejected. |
Neutral losses of precursor to fragments | Add neutral losses of precursor to fragments of the spectrum. |
Neutral losses of fragments to fragments | Add neutral losses among fragments to fragments of the spectrum. |
Polarity | The polarity used for the mode of acquisition. |
Database Search Relative Mass Deviation | A value in ppm that defines the deviation of theoretical masses in the database vs. the measured masses. |
Fragment Peak Match Absolute Mass Deviation | Absolute mass deviation in Dalton of theoretical fragment peaks vs. measured fragment peaks. |
Fragment Peak Match Relative Mass Deviation | Relative mass deviation in ppm of theoretical fragment peaks vs. measured fragment peaks. |
Suspect list | File containing a list of suspects. |
MetFrag Database Type | Database to choose from. |
------------ Output files ------------
+------------------------------------------+--------+ | Files | Format | +==========================================+========+ | 1) (Multiple) MetFrag parameter list(s) | TXT | +------------------------------------------+--------+
---------------------------------------------------
